news.shortDetail: Rumors spread online about changes in tuition fees.
news.detail: A viral post claimed tuition fees would double starting next year. Officials confirmed this is FALSE and clarified no such policy exists. The Ministry of Education emphasized that any changes would be communicated through official channels and involve stakeholder consultation. The misinformation spread rapidly on social media, causing unnecessary panic among students and parents. Authorities urge the public to verify information before sharing.

news.shortDetail: Social media post warns of a deadly new strain.
news.detail: Experts confirmed a new variant exists, but WHO stated it is not more deadly than existing ones. The viral post exaggerated risks. Health officials are monitoring the situation closely and have advised the public to continue following standard precautions. The Ministry of Health reassures that vaccines remain effective, and there is no cause for alarm. Social media users are encouraged to rely on updates from official health organizations.

news.shortDetail: News about eco-friendly farming practices gains attention.
news.detail: The story is TRUE. The award was presented by the Ministry of Agriculture to support eco-friendly initiatives. The farmer implemented innovative irrigation techniques and organic fertilizers, resulting in higher yields and reduced environmental impact. The community has been inspired by these efforts, and several neighboring farms are adopting similar practices. The Ministry plans to expand the program nationwide.

news.shortDetail: A viral video warns of a disaster hitting Southeast Asia.
news.detail: Seismologists confirmed earthquakes cannot be predicted with exact dates. This claim is FALSE. The video is based on misinterpretation of scientific data. Authorities urge the public not to panic and to rely on official sources for disaster preparedness information. Emergency services remain on alert as a precaution, but there is no credible evidence supporting the prediction.

news.shortDetail: Photos shared of students using AI equipment.
news.detail: TRUE story. The new facility aims to support AI and robotics research with state-of-the-art tools. The lab is equipped with advanced computing resources, 3D printers, and collaborative workspaces. Students and faculty are excited about the opportunities for innovation and hands-on learning. The university hopes to attract partnerships with tech companies and foster a culture of research and development.

news.shortDetail: Public transport goes green with new electric buses.
news.detail: The city has introduced a fleet of electric buses to reduce carbon emissions and improve air quality. The initiative is part of a broader sustainability plan and has received positive feedback from commuters. Officials report that the buses are quieter, more efficient, and cost-effective in the long run.

news.shortDetail: Scammers use fake company names to lure applicants.
news.detail: Authorities warn recent graduates about a surge in fake job offers circulating via email and social media. Victims are asked to pay upfront fees for training or materials. The Ministry of Labor advises job seekers to verify company credentials and report suspicious offers.

news.topic: Wildlife reserve sees record tiger births
news.shortDetail: Conservation efforts lead to population growth.
news.detail: Conservationists celebrate a record number of tiger cubs born in the national wildlife reserve this year. The success is attributed to anti-poaching measures and habitat restoration projects. The reserve is now considered a model for wildlife protection in the region.

news.shortDetail: Viral message claims tap water is unsafe.
news.detail: Health officials confirm that recent rumors about water contamination are unfounded. Routine testing shows water quality meets all safety standards. Residents are encouraged to ignore unverified messages and trust official updates.

news.shortDetail: Parents receive misleading text messages.
news.detail: A text message claiming all schools would close for a week due to health concerns was confirmed to be a hoax. The Ministry of Education urges parents to check official announcements.

news.topic: Solar power project powers rural villages
news.shortDetail: Renewable energy brings electricity to remote areas.
news.detail: A government-backed solar project has brought electricity to over 50 rural villages. Residents report improved quality of life and new economic opportunities.

news.topic: Flood warning issued for river towns
news.shortDetail: Authorities urge residents to prepare.
news.detail: Meteorologists have issued a flood warning for towns along the river. Emergency services are on standby, and residents are advised to follow evacuation plans if necessary.

news.shortDetail: Local volunteers grow fresh produce.
news.detail: A community garden initiative has produced a bountiful harvest, providing fresh vegetables to local families. Organizers plan to expand the project to more neighborhoods.

news.topic: Rumor about vaccine side effects debunked
news.shortDetail: Health experts address misinformation.
news.detail: Medical professionals confirm that vaccines are safe and effective. Reports of severe side effects are rare and often unrelated to vaccination.

news.shortDetail: New app helps users learn local languages.
news.detail: A local tech startup has launched a language learning app featuring interactive lessons and games. Early reviews praise its user-friendly design and cultural content.

news.topic: False report of animal escape at zoo
news.shortDetail: Zoo officials deny rumors.
news.detail: A social media post claimed several animals escaped from the city zoo. Zoo officials confirm all animals are accounted for and the post is false.

news.shortDetail: City encourages residents to recycle.
news.detail: The city has introduced a new recycling program with convenient drop-off points. Residents are encouraged to participate to reduce landfill waste.

news.shortDetail: Students develop innovative project.
news.detail: A local school team has won the national science competition with a project on renewable energy. The students received praise for their creativity and teamwork.

news.shortDetail: Artists showcase local talent.
news.detail: A new art exhibition featuring works by local artists has opened in the city center. The event aims to promote cultural appreciation and support emerging talent.

news.topic: False claim about new tax law
news.shortDetail: Finance Ministry clarifies policy.
news.detail: A viral post claimed a new tax law would increase rates for all citizens. The Finance Ministry clarified that no such law has been passed and urges the public to check official sources.

comments.text: I saw this on Facebook, thanks for clarifying!
Scary how misinformation spreads so fast.
Great to see recognition for local farmers!
